column4: is HD5850 supported on Ubuntu? I'm thinking of buying it. How's the general experience of ATi on Linux? (currently I'm using 9600gt)
all i can say about ATI is..  dont do it. :)
if you can use Nvidia - then do so.
depends on  your budget and needs.
I need it for a dual monitor system on KDE4 (Kubuntu) and for gaming -on W7-
its all about your budget then.
I would like to buy somethink like 5830 - 5850 range
whats your GPU, if you don't mind I'm asking? :)
3+ yrs old.. and does the job fine.. I dont see the point in getting a $300+ video card these days.
hmm maybe you're right, but personally I would prefer a better one, because I'm using it as a gaming console too :)
I'm sorry If I'm flooding you with questions but last one: is GTX465 (and newer) are supported on Ubuntu?
check the forums see if anyone has had issues with them
thank you for your help :) I'm gonna buy a NV card, I don't know which one to buy but I'll definitely find out :)
